name: Biological Self
description: A local-first, privacy-preserving AI health repository with 3D anatomical interface for symptom tracking and physiological education. Counter-narrative to cloud-dependent healthcare AI.
vision: Enable individuals to maintain complete ownership of their health data locally, with AI-assisted symptom recording via voice, anatomical body mapping, and educational explanations of physiological processes - all without data ever leaving their device.
principles: Local-first: All data stored encrypted on user's device, never in cloud
Privacy by design: No telemetry, no external API calls for health data
Educational, not diagnostic: Teach physiology, never provide medical advice
Incremental value: Each feature works standalone, compounds together
Medical accuracy: Use validated anatomical models and physiological references

reasoning.notes: Best for chain-of-thought physiology reasoning, ~6GB VRAM

general.notes: Strong medical/scientific knowledge, good structured output. 14B needs ~12GB, 7B needs ~6GB

fast.notes: Quick responses for simple extraction tasks, ~6GB VRAM

notRecommended: Kimi K2 - Cloud API only, not available for local deployment
GLM-4 full - Too large (100B+) for consumer hardware
GLM-4 Flash - API service only, no local weights available

hardwareRequirements.recommended: 24GB unified memory - can run full setup comfortably
hardwareRequirements.optimal: 32GB+ for running multiple models simultaneously or 70B class models
hardwareRequirements.current: 24GB unified memory (M-series Mac) - USE FULL SETUP

voiceInput.notes: All models run fully local, no audio data leaves device

techStack.anatomyAssets: BodyParts3D (open source) or licensed Zygote models
